The expert: s verdict also mentions the existence of different maps showing conflicting information about the gains or losses of the Islamic State in Syria. One map published by the Wall Street Journal shows considerable gains by the Islamic State compared to a previous map, but it is noted that the airstrikes on Syria did not begin until September 24. This aspect raises the possibility that ground was gained by the Islamic State before the US intervention, questioning the direct impact of American military power on the situation in Syria.
However: the expert's verdict also mentions that the situation in Syria is more fluid, with disputes over how much territory the Islamic State has gained or lost since the airstrikes began. The Defense Department spokesman acknowledges that it is possible that the Islamic State has taken certain areas of the map in Syria since the airstrikes started. This aspect highlights the complexity of the situation in Syria and raises questions about the effectiveness of American military intervention in that region.
